channel.title: Sergio Cantero Chinchilla
channel.description: Recent content on Sergio Cantero Chinchilla

item.title: Uncertainty quantification in deep learning methods
item.description: Introduction Deep learning methods can be highly accurate and efficient, but that comes at a cost. Typically, the generalisability of the methods is compromised outside the range of parameters in which they have been trained on. As an example of this, if a network is trained to predict thickness values between 7mm and 12mm, outside of this range the network output is not necessarily very accurate. Uncertainty quantification methods in deep learning helps:

item.title: Data Science for NDE
item.description: Introduction Automation of non-destructive evaluation (NDE) processes has typically relied on rudimentary tools that support a trained operator manually interpreting data. The abundance of data and implementation of Internet of Things and Industry 4.0 provide a new exciting opportunity to extract more accurate information in a more efficient manner - hence, enabling automation. A general framework for the automation in ultrasonic NDE enabled by deep learning is provided below. Automation levels for ultrasonic NDE [1].

item.title: About Me
item.description: I am a Lecturer in Digital and Data-Driven Engineering of the School of Electrical, Electronic, and Mechanical Engineering of the University of Bristol, UK. Research-wise, I am based in the Ultrasonic and Non-destructive Testing (UNDT) group of the University of Bristol. My research interests include: Deep learning Uncertainty quantification Non-Destructive Evaluation and Structural Health Monitoring Optimal sensor placement I am active in these research areas and you can see the main developments in the research pages.

item.title: People
item.description: PhD Students Explainability of deep learning methods applied to NDE (FIND-CDT) Yuyang Liu (Eric) (2023-Present) Machine Learning-assisted Bioprinting Platform for Bone Scaffolds Fabrication Rixiang Quan (2021-Present) Research Associates Deep learning uncertainty quantification & laser ultrasound (RCNDE & EPSRC) Mohammad Ali Fakih (2023-Present)
